Dear Madam, In reply to your letter of 9th January, I write to say that we had already heard from Sir Geoffrey Prior on the subject of a passage for yourself and your children. Sir Geoffrey stated that he understood from your husband that application had been made by the Iraqi Government through the Iraqi Legation in London and the Crown Agents for the Colonies but on enquiry through the Foreign Office we have been informed that neither the Iraqi Legation nor the Crown Agents have, so far as it can be ascertained, received such an application. We would therefore suggest that you should inform your husband accordingly in order that he may approach the Iraqi Government again. Alternatively you might make enquiries yourself from the Iraqi Legation, whose address is 22, Queen's Gate, London, S.W.7. The Department of His Majesty's Government primarily concerned is the Foreign Office, to whom a copy of this letter and yours under reply is being sent. Yours faithfully, l • Mrs. J. N. titleInfo.title: Ext 4825/44 'Capt J N Gordon, Commander of Nearchus: application for passages for wife & family'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 15; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence regarding a request by Captain Gordon to have his wife and two children transported to Basra to join him. The primary correspondents are: Lieutenant-Colonel Sir Charles Geoffrey Prior, Political Resident, Persian Gulf; India Office; Foreign Office; Agnes S Gordon, Captain Gordon’s wife.
